page.title: 11Farming in New Mills
page.content: There are no crops growing on the hills because they are too bumpy. So it is used for enclosed rough grazing.There are 37 farms in Newtown and New Mills.If you walk along the Sett Valley Trail you can see a good view of the farmland.Our teacher lives on a farm called Brow Farm between Hague Bar Road and High Lea Road.New Mills is mostly residential and farmland. Traditionally the area had been largely grassland for grazing sheep and cattle with very little grain production, mainly of oats.Milk was probably the most important farm product of the 1850s although there may have been a development of arable farming to provide vegetables for the growing population of the town.
